intro: Pisonia taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds enclosed in a fibrous, hairy coating. Pisonia taitensis thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in dense shrubs or small trees. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
